title: Russia: Citi Wins Consumer Rights and Quality Service Award
summary: Moscow - Citibank has been named the winner of the 3rd Annual Consumer Rights and Quality Service Prize in the Financial Literacy and Openness category. The awards ceremony was held at the Russian Chamber of Commerce and Industry, and was attended by Gennady Onishchenko, head of Russia's Federal Consumer Protection Service.
tag-1: Russia: Citi Wins Consumer Rights and Quality Service Award
tag-2: Moscow – Citibank has been named the winner of the 3rd Annual Consumer Rights and Quality Service Prize in the Financial Literacy and Openness category. The awards ceremony was held at the Russian Chamber of Commerce and Industry, and was attended by Gennady Onishchenko, head of Russia's Federal Consumer Protection Service.
tag-3: Accepting the award, Sergey Korotkov, Retail Banking Business Head for Citibank in Russia, said: "For us, it is a great honor and responsibility to win in this award. Our bank pays much attention to the issue of raising the quality of financial education of consumers of financial services. We consider our expenditures on financial literacy programs to be long-term investments in the development of human potential, which in turn will foster prosperity in Russia's region and facilitate the sustainable development of our business."
tag-4: The Federal Consumer Protection Service and the Social Projects and Programs Foundation established the Consumer Rights and Quality Service Prize in 2010. The award was organized with support from the Russian Ministry of Industry and Trade, Government of the City of Moscow, Association of Retail Trade Companies, Federal Agency for Print and Mass Communications, Russian Union of Journalists, ECR-Rus, Russian Consumers Union and others.
tag-5: There were awards in the following categories: Retail Sales; Retail Services; Consumer Goods; Financial Literacy and Openness; as well as in a number of non-commercial categories including Personal Contribution to the Formation of a Civilized Consumer Market, Professional Contribution to the Formation of the Russian Consumer Market and Effective Protection of Consumer Rights – which were awarded to non-commercial organizations and public groups for their efforts to protect consumer rights.
tag-6: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-8: ZAO Citibank  ZAO Citibank, a full subsidiary of Citi, has been operating in Russia since 1993. At present ZAO Citibank is among the country's largest banks offering a full range of products and services to corporate and consumer customers. Citibank has over 3,000 employees; its distribution network includes retail branches, 550 ATMs and representative offices in largest cities in Russia, Citi also operates in Ukraine and Kazakhstan. The number of the bank's consumer clients has exceeded 1,000,000 Russians. www.citibank.ru.
